title: Translate and package retrieved articles using an external translator implementation
content:
You can use an external ArticleRetriever wrapper implementation to generate machine translations for articles that are extracted using any ArticleRetriever plugin implementation.

Note The external translation wrapper implementation is not developed or supported by OpenText.

To use the ArticleRetrieverTranslationWrapper implementation:

  1. Create a Microsoft Windows Azure account and log in: https://login.live.com/login.srf.
  2. Subscribe to the Microsoft Translator API: http://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/bing/microsofttranslator.
  3. Go to your Windows Azure account: https://datamarket.azure.com/account.
  4. Register a new application: https://datamarket.azure.com/developer/applications/register.
  5. In the client ID field, provide a unique name, for example, Article-Translator. You can also use this name in the name and description fields.
  6. In the redirect URL field, provide any working URL. For example, https://www.microsoft.com.
  7. Copy the Client-secret string, which looks something like this: 
    l72isD4EfpzvCIPVORXplSQ+v5V1qSJQg5wdPid8g=
  8. Surround the client secret string with double quotes and add it to the article retriever command line:  
    “l72isD4EfpzvCIPVORXplSQ+v5V1qSJQg5wdPid8g="
  9. Click Create.
  10. Download the microsoft-translator-java-api-0.6.2-jar-with-dependencies.jar file: https://code.google.com/p/microsoft-translator-java-api/downloads/detail?name=microsofttranslator-java-api-0.6.2-jar-with-dependencies.jar.
  11. Copy the file into the <Packaging_tool_deployment>/user_lib folder.
